pageContext.claim: “If anybody else -- if any of these people that I've been watching on this stage got elected, your 401(k)s would be down the tubes. They'd go down not 20 percent or 30 percent; they'd go down 70, 90, 80 [Percent], and destroy this country.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump inherited an economy that was in the middle of one of the longest post-World War II economic expansions on record. Most of the trends that Trump points to as "success" started under Obama. There is no evidence it would not have continued if Clinton had been elected and no evidence that electing a Democrat would cause an economic crash.
